column1: length outside off, Warner shapes to leave it but is indecisive, the ball takes the full face of the bat, trickles away to point, and the fielder hurls a throw at the striker's end, misses the stumps and it races away for overthrows
sharp inswinger, hurries onto Williamson, strikes him on the thigh
full on off, hint of away movement their, pushed to mid-off
the knuckle ball, comes hooping back in, Williamson waits for it and pushes it towards cover-point for a quick single
length on middle, shape away from Warner, who stays back and defends to the off side
another slower ball, floated up in the pads, pushed past mid-on, who gives chase but the timing is good for three
length on middle, shaping away from warner, who pushes to point, they take off for a single and a needless throw at the striker's end, with Williamson past the stumps, leads to more overthrows
poor fielding on the boundary and that's four! Royals have been sloppy so far, it was short outside off, cut away to third-man where Varun Aaron lets it through his legs
length on off, defended to point
short outside off, Williamson rocks back then gets on his toes to control the bounce and chops it away to third-man for one
length on the pads, hurries onto Warner who tries to work it towards squareleg but is struck on the thigh pad, They come through for a couple
short ball, angled across, not a lot of bounce but Warner sways out of its way
full outside off, Williamson tries to chop it away with an angled bat, is beaten on the outside edge
knuckle ball, swerves back in but Williamson picks it, waits for it and defends it back to the bowler
length outside off, Williamson punches it to cover-point and Stuart Binny misfields this time, allowing a couple, when it should have been a dot
full outside off, Williamson square drives it, opening the face of the bat at the last moment to bisect point and cover-point
full outside off, hint of swing back in, driven to mid-off's left for one
full on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg for one
length on middle, punched to extra cover off the backfoot
googly on middle, pushed to mid-off for one
googly on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on middle, Williamson skips down and pushes it back to the bowler

cleaned him up! It was a googly on middle, the length was the key as it had Williamson in two minds, in the end he stayed rooted to the crease, the ball hurried back into him before crashing into the stumps

full outside off, and Pandey opens his account with a full-blooded drive past mid-off for four. It was overpitched, sho he didn't have to worry about which way it was turning and could go through the line
length on middle, pushed to point for a quick single
full on off, driven to mid-off and they scamper another single
length outside off, steered towards third-man for one
short on middle and Pandey, in the form that he is in, pulls this imperiously, and off the frontfoot, in front of square for four
full on middle, driven past the bowler, the mid-on has to put in a dive to his left to keep them to one
slower ball on middle, punched towards extra cover for one
short and angled across, slower ball, Warner tries to drag it to the on side, doesn't get all of it but clears mid-on, and it travels far enough for three
short ball at the body, Pandey is caught between ducking and hooking, in the end helps the ball along to deep squareleg with astonishing control, given that his eyes were never on the ball
length on the pads, clipped to midwicket
length on middle, Warner backs away and guides it past point for one
length outside off, too much width and Pandey pounces on it, punching it between point and cover-point for another boundary
short outside off, uses the pace, angles the bat and guides it to third-man for one
full on middle, pushed back past the bowler, Warner and the bowler collide as Riyan dives to his right, but he recovers in time to complete the run
length on off, punched to deep cover
full on middle, driven to long-on
length outside off, punched to extra cover, who lets it through and allows a single
length on off, punched to long-off
length on off, Warner rocks back and punches to deep cover for one
length outside off, Warner pushes it to long-off for one
length on off, Pandey cuts straight to cover-point
length outside off, Pandey waits for it a little longer, and cuts it finer, bisecting point and cover-point for four
short on middle, keeps pretty low, Pandey was already shaping for the pull shot, adjusts beautifully, going lower with his hands and hammering it along the ground to the deep squareleg fence
length on middle, tucked away for one
short on middle, Warner looks to cut but can't beat cover-point
full on off, driven to long-off
quicker one on middle, Warner beaten by the length, manages to push it to long-off
length on the pads, Pandey tucks it away towards deep squareleg, pacing it well for two
full on middle, it's overpitched and Pandey can go through the line, hammers it over the bowlers head
short ball on middle and pulled this time, hit hard and placed equally well, between deep squareleg and deep midwicket
full on off, pushed to cover
full on middle, Warner goes inside out over cover, not usually his shot off the frontfoot, but placed well for two
full on middle, quicker one, pushed to long-on
short ball and Pandey rocks back to pull but can't beat deep backward squareleg
googly, generously tossed up, on the pads, and clipped to deep squareleg
length on off, pushed to extra cover
length outside off, Pandey waits for it and takes it almost from the keeper's gloves and nearly beats short third-man, who gets a hand on it on the dive to his left to keep them to two
back of a length and given room outside off, slashed away but there is a sweeper cover, so Warner still doesn't have a boundary
slower bouncer, Warner pulls it gently to deep square leg
fuller, outside off, pushed to extra cover
another slower ball on a length, he waits for it and turns it with soft hands towards square leg. Hit softly enough for them to take a quick two
slower ball again, back of a length outside off. Warner goes for the pull but only gets an under-edge that bounces to the keeper

that one surprised him with the bounce. It was only 120 kph, but reared up off a length outside off and Warner ended up fending it off from above his waist while quickly taking his top hand off the bat
misses his line, down legside and that'll be a wide
length ball on the stumps, he goes deep in his crease and swats it to deep midwicket
drilled. Pandey must have faced a lot of Binny in the Karnataka nets, but anyone getting a half-volley on off would have put this away. Straight back past the bowler

good fielding by Livingstone, pleasant change from the standards Royals have maintained in the field today. Short of a length outside off and Pandey slapped it over extra cover, almost tennis ball style from shoulder height. Livingstone made good ground and parried the ball in to save the boundary
good length  on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
full on the stumps and driven back fluently, but Binny gets a leg on it and they get only a single. But that's enough to raise fifty for Pandey. It's been a fine innings
short on leg stump, pulled from waist height but there is a man at deep square. Warner's wait for a boundary continues...

brilliant catch by Smith length ball on middle, Warner backed away a long way and tried to slap this over extra cover. Doesn't time it and it swirls high off the top edge over mid-off. Smith runs back and dives full length to his right to hold on to the ball.
146 kph length ball on the stumps, Pandey stays beside it and steers to point

back of a length on the stumps, Vijay is pushed on the back foot and he pats it back. They decide on the quick single and Riyan charges in from cover and has a shy, but Pandey is quick and would have been just home even with a direct hit
another pacy 144kph delivery on the stumps on a length, pushed past a diving Riyan at cover
and there comes the bouncer, on target outside off and Vijay is forced to sway out of the way and drop his hands
back of a length again on the stumps, 147 kph that time. He stays on the back foot and guides it to third man by opening the face
drags it down a bit short and whipped to long on from off stump
full ball, driven to long-off
full on the stumps, driven to long-on
down the ground again, wanted to go aerial, but doesn't get hold of it fully. Long-off collects on the bounce
shorter and flatter, top spinner, he clips it to midwicket from the stumps
tucked to short fine leg
almost a yorker, he stays back and shovels it over the bowler's head
goes deep in his crease to pull this and times it well, but deep midwicket is there and collects on the bounce
takes a step down and gives himself room to square drive this length ball to deep point
drags it short but gets it to spin across Vijay, who goes back and uses his wrists to turn it to square leg
brilliance. Full ball on the stumps, bowled a bit quicker, Pandey gives himself room and carves it over extra cover for a peachy boundary

we might have a stumping here Pandey waits on this and late cuts it, but seemed to lose balance and Samson broke the stumps. And that's brilliant work by Samson. He broke the stumps right when Pandey's foot was in the air. Oh wait, that's actually caught behind. Though it would have been stumped too. Pandey cut it so fine, it went into Samson's gloves and he held on. The batsman seemed to think about setting off for a run then decided against it, and in that process, lost balance. Samson broke the stumps at that precise moment too.
great effort by Samson but puts the edge down Full ball and Vijay drives with feet not moving, it takes the outside edge. Samson flies to his right but can only get a glove to it, doesn't stick
length ball on leg stump, tucked towards midwicket
shovelled this length ball over the in-field on the legside. Pops in the air and wasn't timed but falls safe
down the track but Aaron follows him and he can only mis-time his drive to deep extra cover

taken by Unadkat running in from deep square leg Shankar hadn't looked fluent, and he gets a top edge to this intended pull. The ball hangs in the air long enough for Unadkat to run in and take a tumbling catch. Just reward for Aaron who has bowled well without luck so far
fuller outside off, punched to deep point

put down by Aaron diving to his left at short fine Length ball outside off, Shakib walked way across his stumps and tried to flick it fine. Didn't time it, so the ball wasn't travelling fast. Aaron dived to his left and got hands to it, but couldn't hold on

brilliant return catch by Unadkat. He's shown Michael Jordan-like hang-time in the air. Brilliantly bowled slower ball on the stumps on a length. Hooda has no clue about it, way too early into the flick and he pops it in the air. It's flying above Unadkat but he times his jump perfectly in the follow through to pluck it with his left hand stretched out full, in the air. And he's pumped.
length ball on the stumps, worked to square leg
good length outside off again, paddled to square leg
goes around the wicket and angles it on the pads, flicked to deep square
shimmies down the track and carves it to the man on the cover boundary, but not timed well at all. Just a single
slower ball and Shakib had to adjust. Was walking across, this was on a length on middle, and he waits for it and paddles it to fine leg
and he's surprised him with a short one there. 146 kph, coming into him. Saha sways out of the way but gets bat on it to push it to cover
walking across again but that is too far down leg and will be a wide
this time he was giving himself room instead of walking across, and Oshane bowls a short of length ball on leg stump, cramping him for room. Chopped into the off side
sitter dropped by Shreyas Gopal at fine leg that was a quick one that hurried on to Saha, who could only paddle it straight up in the air. It was going straight to Gopal, who fluffed it.

Oshane's not going to be denied for long. Saha's been out of cricket for a while and a pacy, back of length ball that's zipping in from off is not the easiest to face. He was giving himself room to try and swat it into the legside, but gets a thin top edge that is held by Samson behind the stumps.
greeted by a snorting bouncer first up and he ducks well under it

holes out to wide long on another slower ball, length outside off. Shakib tries to fetch it from there and wants to pull it to midwicket, but it's a long boundary and he has to generate all the power himself. Doesn't get enough on it and Shreyas Gopal is eager to make amends for the earlier drop, runs around to his left from long-on to hold on to a good catch
good length on middle and leg, slower one again. Tucked to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, he's not bowling any of them at normal pace. Swatted across the line, gets it off the bottom half of the bat to long-on
and that's a ball bowled at normal pace, length on off, goes through Bhuvneshwar
back of a length from around the wicket, angling into him. Slower ball again. pushed into the offside for a single
back of length outside off again, steered to backward point
quick one, on a length outside off, he's late into the pull and it goes off the end of the bat towards long-on
Samson's missed it Aaron dug in the slower bouncer and Bhuvi had to sway out of the way while trying to ramp it. Samson went to his left but the ball went under his glove

third brilliant catch of the match by Unadkat Another back of hand slower one, and Bhuvi was giving himself room but Aaron bowled it on his pads. He tried to flick it, too early into the shot, and it takes the leading edge and swirls to square leg. Samson is running but Unadkat calls out, running in and dives in front to take it
slower ball down leg, tried to sweep it but misses. Will be wide though
another slower ball, he's down the track to swat it over cow corner but it takes the inside edge to fine leg. They hustle for two, the fielder there was a mite slow in getting to the ball
that was a normal pace delivery, 143 kph, very full outside off and Rashid clears his front leg to power it over extra cover for a much-needed boundary

finishes the innings in style This was a slower one again but Rashid was waiting for it and he slaps it straight back over the bowler's head with a horizontal bat and it hits the boundary skirting on the full at long-off
full outside off, pushes to point
full outside off, comes forward confidently and defends towards cover
full outside off, another lovely, confident stride into the ball and caressed through extra cover
full on middle, checks his shot and pushes it to mid-on
full outside off, Rahane pushes to extra cover without any timing on that occasion
full on the pads, slower ball, nearly clipped to short fine-leg, falls just short
length, angled in, skids on to Livingstone as he pushes it to midwicket off the backfoot
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
length on middle, pushed down the ground to long-on for one
full and angled in, Rahane walks across and tucks it away
slower and angled in, comes down the wicket and pushes it through midwicket
length on middle, Rahane uses the depth of the crease and tucks it away towards squareleg for one
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
slower ball outside off, backs away slightly and crunches it straight to cover
full on the pads and nonchalantly chipped over mid-on, a few bounces and into the boundary
slower ball on middle, Rahane pushes it back to the bowler
full on the pads, Bhuvneshwar followed Rahane as he saw him backing away but he adjusted to the change in line and picked it up to deep squareleg's right, timing it beautifully
full on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg's right along the ground this time and they come through for an easy couple
googly on middle, Livingstone clips it to deep squareleg for one
length on middle, slower through the air, Rahane goes down on one knee and picks it up with the angle, with the ball sliding on, clears deep midwicket
full on middle, pushed through midwicket
tossed up on middle and Royals are tearing into Rashid Khan, Livingstone launches this over deep midwicket
length on middle, hurries onto him but he pushes it down the ground and they come through for two
legspinner, full on middle, Livingstone turns the face too early, gets a leading edge but along the ground towards cover
full and angled across, pushed back to the bowler
slower ball outside off, holds in the surface, first one to do so this innings, Rahane adjusts and steers it down to third-man
length, angled into the body, Livingstone looks to pull but it hurries onto him and he takes it on the body, unable to make contact with the bat
slower ball outside off, pushed to extra cover
slower one on middle, Livingstone clears his front leg to go through the leg side, but only manages to push it along the ground to long-on
slower one outside off, Rahane makes room and throws his bat at it, the outside edge flies over short third-man and into the boundary
length and angled in, Livingstone helps it along with the angle, to deep squareleg's right for four
slower ball on middle, it was on a length and there for the taking but Livingstone misses he swings wildly and early
length on middle and he gets hold of this one, predictable length, slightly agricultural but picked up over deep squareleg
length and angled in, much quicker delivery, slightly fuller as well and beats him as he has another ugly swing
length on middle again and that's feeding his strength, Livingstone goes straighter this time, to mid-on's right but hit powerfully for another four

looked like he'd miscued that but flat bats it over mid-on and it carries all the way! It was a shorter slower ball, on off stump, he had to drag it a little but got hold of it and deposited it over long-on with a tennis forehand
full on middle, pushed back
legspinner outside off, Rahane tentative coming forward, beaten on the outside edge
length on middle, Rahane goes down on one knee and scoops it to short fine-leg
attempted ramp over the keeper, he is struck on the pad and they take a review for lbw as the umpire turns the appeal down! But struck well outside off and would have missed off
googly on middle, he seems to have picked this one up, rocks back and pulls hard and flat, bisecting deep squareleg and deep midwicket
full on middle, comes forward, turns the face and works it to deep midwicket's right and they turn for the second and complete it comfortably
full on middle, pushed to cover
length on middle, Rahane opens up a little and punches it off the backfoot to long-on
tossed up on middle, Livingstone skips down the wicket and drills it down the ground, and hits it so powerfully that it beats long-on, who didn't have to move much to his left
short outside off, cut away to deep cover
short outside off, pushed to deep cover
slows is down and pulls his length back as he sees Livingstone advance, but the batsman adjusts well and pushes it back to the bowler after being deceived in the air
length on the pads, clipped to fine-leg for one
slower ball outside off, tries to steer it to third-man but misses
full outside off, drilled along the ground to long-off for one
yorker outside off, squeezed straight to point
short ball, angled in, Rahane misses the hook, not called wide as it slips down the leg side
slower ball on middle, Rahane is deceived b the change in pace as he tries to lift it to the on side, it hung in the air forever but luckily for him fell well short of long-on
Rashid strikes! Quicker one on off, Livingstone plays back and gets a feather to the keeper, who latches on to give Sunrisers some breathing space
length on off, turns sharply away from Samson as he pokes tentatively
full on off, comes forward and defends to extra cover
full on off, pushed to extra cover again
nearly through him! Tossed up outside off, it was the googly, Samson tried to drive through the covers and was beaten on the inside edge
gets some shape in the air but too far down leg and that will be a wide
what a shot! Full outside off and he hits on the rise, driving it over extra cover and straight over the boundary too
the pressure is telling on Kaul, he slides one down leg again for another wide
width and too short outside off but he finds point with his slash
back of a length outside off and gets it to rise up a bit, Samson is forced to pat it down with a horizontal bat with a last-minute adjustment
length ball on off, flicked by walking across the stumps, past midwicket
walking across so that will not be a wide, though it was short and outside the tram line
length ball outside off, punched to long-off
down the track and has a thrash at it down the ground, but doesn't get hold of it properly and long-on collects
goes deep in his crease to pull this to deep midwicket, where Vijay Shankar runs around and cuts off the boundary

he's picked out long-off. Warner's the fielder there and he's not going to drop too many. Full outside off but Rahane couldn't get properly underneath it. Was giving himself room and looking to go over extra cover, ends up spooning to long-off where Warner runs in and completes a smart catch
length ball, turning away from off, punched to cover

very full, almost yorker length, flicked off his toes to deep midwicket and they sprint for the second. Manish Pandey is quickly onto the ball and releases a fast throw, but they had enough time for two
lovely shot. Down the track and converts this to a half volley, similar shot to last ball but placed a little straighter and finds the midwicket boundary
slower ball but picked up so beautifully. Full and wide outside off, and he languidly caresses it into the gap between point and cover. The timing on that sends it racing
smacked. This is almost disdainful. Back of a length and he essays a front-foot pull that finds the deep square leg fence
slower ball on off, nipping in, he comes on the front foot and uses his wrists to turn it to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, whipped to long-on
back of a length outside off, slapped past point
full toss outside off, flat-batted swat to midwicket and they take two
innovation by Smith, pre-meditated a paddle and Rashid bowled this on leg. Lifts it over the keeper but off the toe end
googly and he had no clue about it. Jabbed at it last moment and it takes the inside edge to short fine leg
length ball on leg, tucked to fine leg
length ball and he goes deep in his crease to turn it to square leg. Sensible option to give himself time to read it off the pitch, since he's not picking them off the hand
fuller leg break on off and pushed tentatively towards cover. They take a quick single
good length outside off, Smith stretches forward to block it. That's Rashid done for this game.
angling in on a length on the pads and Samson easily picks it off to deep midwicket with a flick of the wrist

dropped by Rashid running forward from deep square leg! Front foot pull by Samson but didn't time it and it takes the top edge. Rashid is running in, but the ball swerves away from him a bit, and he gets both hands to it to his left, but drops it
short ball again, and he clips it between deep midwicket and long-on
length ball angling on the pads again, and turned to deep midwicket. They think about the second but decide against it and Smith makes his groun din time
oh that's a bad ball. Angling on the pads again and Smith just tickles it fine, very fine. Gift
better ball, yorker on the stumps, tapped to cover for a single
full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
too far down leg and that will be wide. SRH can't afford these extras
dig it in short and pulled gently to fine leg
good length, seaming back into him, tucks him up and clipped to mid-on
good length and tight line on the fourth stump, steered to point
very full on the stumps and Smith moves across to clip it off his toes to fine leg. Sprints hard to come back for the second, no direct hit so he's safe
ooh a beauty to end, moving in from back of a length and beats bat on the way to the keeper
disdainful. Short of a length outside off and he stands in his crease and pulls from outside off stump to deep midwicket. Stunning
fuller length outside off, pushed past cover

moves across his crease again and Khaleel is too straight. Smith is able to flick it nicely to fine leg. Kaul puts in the dive to save the ball, but his boot has touched the boundary. So that will be four
down the track and he spots him and shortens the length, but still too much room and Smith slaps it to deep cover
good length on the fourth stump line, he takes a big stride out and pushes it to long-off
taken at fine leg. Finally gets the short ball on target and Smith is hurried into the pull, gets a top edge. Kaul manages to latch on to it at fine leg.

Ashton Turner survives his first ball and receives a round of applause from his dug out. Full on the legs and he flicks it to deep square. Even Bhuvi is smiling. Turner maintains a deadpan face though he did smile a bit when he ran
coming into him and rolls off the pads towards square leg. They take a leg bye
length ball outside off and he tries to stroke it through cover, but mis-times it
length ball coming into him from outside off, he wants to smack it over cow corner but gets it to short midwicket only off the inside half of the bat
good length outside off, tight line but he gets low and chops it to third man. He has a second run now!

good length again outside off and coming in to him, jabbed to mid-off. Samson calls late for a quick single but luckily for Turner, he's stretched out full and made his ground. Would have been really tragic to be run out through no fault of his own after all those ducks
flicked uppishly to wide long-on.
low full toss on off, whipped to deep midwicket
yorker on off stump, dug back out to the bowler
short ball and he's lucky it lands safe. But Turner's surely deserved some luck. Was climbing on him and he went to pull, gets a top edge that lands behind the bowler, but in front of mid-on
strays on the pads again, and Samson misses the flick, but it rolls to short fine for a leg bye
full toss outside off, he went to drive it through cover but misses it. The ball goes past off stump to the keeper
he's finished it off the first ball. Too short and allows Samson to go deep in his crease and swat a pull shot to the midwicket boundary.
